text: gone are the days that a heroic leader
can carry an organization on his or her
back alone it's about it's a team game
and I think the whole process at Harvard
that first year of where you're in a
study group and you're tackling a case
with a group of people that's what the
real world is like I'm not out there
solving problems alone I may be at the
microphone alone a lot this is a team
game that I run I learned that at
Harvard Business School almost every day
we are confronted with a new dilemma a
new dilemma of management where we have
competing responsibilities so you have
your investors on one side your
employees on another side uh maybe the
public has another interest in your
customers and the question is how do you
frame a course of action that's going to
be uh responsive and responsible to all
these competing constituencies the need
for general managers is enormous at a
global scale at a regional scale at a
country scale and uh at the level of
Entrepreneurship people who can really
put all the pieces together and be
successful what we're talking about with
General management is someone who can
integrate all the parts of the
Enterprise into a holistic uh
functioning entity and at the same time
interface with the many external
constituencies that that organization
has to uh interact with so it's an
enormously important job and it's far
more than the sum of its parts you can't
simply take marketing find Finance
technology operations and each of these
pieces and become a general manager
there really is an art uh to taking
those pieces integrating them into
something that's bigger than the sum of
those parts I really wanted to come here
because I wanted to be in the company of
other really smart people who who had
the same goal and that is to go out and
Lead something we need leadership skills
in everything not just business by the
way we need to send leaders into our
medical system and our education system
and into our nonprofits
and um we have a lot of things to fix
[Music]
